question: 驚く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>surprised</kanji>, so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to be surprised</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What are you so surprised by? Your friend's <reading>odor</reading> (<ja>おどろ</ja>). Think of a friend that you wouldn't expect to be so smelly. Then, be surprised by the odor. Eww, bro, you have to take a shower.
